info.title: PlanetSide 2 API
info.summary: Public API for PlanetSide 2 community developers
info.description:
Unofficial API specification for [PlanetSide 2](https://www.planetside2.com/) as made available through the [Daybreak Game Company Census API](http://census.daybreakgames.com/).

These API specs are not affiliated with Daybreak Game Company, Rogue Planet Games, or the PlanetSide 2 developer team and come with absolutely no warranty.

externalDocs.description: Official documentation for the documentation for the PlanetSide 2 API.

servers.description: Casual-use Daybreak Games endpoint, throttled to 10 requests per minute and IP address
Production Daybreak Games endpoint, with service ID

serviceId.description: Unique string used to identify a given consumer on the API. The default value of `s:example` underlies the same rate limits as the endpoint without service ID information. A custom service ID can be requested via [this form](https://census.daybreakgames.com/#devSignup).

servers.description:
Unofficial Community endpoint for static data.
Visit the project URL for details.

tags.name: Game-Agnostic Endpoints
tags.description: Generic documentation of the Census API endpoints available for all games. The PlanetSide 2 endpoints are listed separtely to provide more detail, but they generally also support the full set of query parameters and commands list here. For a list of exceptions, see the ["Special" PS2 Collections](https://census.daybreakgames.com/#special-collections) section of the Census API documentation.

tags.name: Character Information
tags.description: Collections related to PlanetSide 2 character information and lookups.

tags.name: Basics
tags.description: General information about factions, classes, continents, and servers in PlanetSide 2.

get.description:
Return a list of all collections available for the current game namespace.

The keys in the entries' `resolve_list` field can be passed to the `c:resolve` parameter when accessing the respective collection to insert additional data into the response payload.

Note that while the examples only show a single record, this endpoint cannot be filtered and always returns all results.

get.summary: Get the number of records in a collection
get.description:
Instead of returning the given results directly, this endpoint returns the number of results.

This is especially useful for large collections which cannot be fetched in full, such as `ps2/character`. This endpoint still supports filtering by parameters, as well as some query commands such as `c:has`.

Consumers may also want to query the result count for a given query before fetching to decide whether to paginate the response.
This endpoint documents generic parameters available on most collections. For details on collection-specific variables and response schemas, please see the respective collection's query entry.

Game-specific documentation for the `character` collection.

This collection is randomly distributed across 20 different databases, causing some unusual behaviour when filtering. For example, the `c:distinct` parameter will fetch the distinct values for each database and aggregate them in the response, resulting in duplicate entries. This and other special cases are documented with the corresponding query command parameters in the `General` section.

In addition to the commonly-used parameters provided, this endpoint may be queried by any of its fields, including sub-keys like `times.creation`.
Optimized, low-bandwidth endpoint for character name resolution.

Enumeration of the six infantry classes for each playable faction.

Note that this is different from the in-game loadouts, which are not available on the API.

Original endpoint for infantry profiles. This covers the names and loadout IDs connected to a given profile, and additionally provides movement speed multiplier information for infantry classes. Note that the key fields are also provided by `ps2/profile_2`, which not only covers infantry but also vehicles, deployables, and other entities.
Extended profile endpoint containing all entity types, including NPCs, construction items, and deployables.

collectionParam.name: collection
collectionParam.description: Name of the collection to access.

qcShowParam.name: c:show
qcShowParam.description: If set, only the response keys listed will be included in the response object. Overrides `c:hide`. Multiple fields can be comma-separated. Dot-notation is supported to select sub-keys.

qcHideParam.name: c:hide
qcHideParam.description: If set, the given response fields will be excluded from the response. If `c:show` is also set, this parameter will be ignored. Multiple fields can be comma-separated. Dot-notation is supported to select sub-keys.

qcSortParam.name: c:sort
qcSortParam.description: Allows sorting the results by one or more fields. Multiple fields can be comma-separated. The sorting direction can be specified by appending `:1` (ascending, default) or `:-1` (descending).

factionAsp.summary: Sort by faction (asc) and ASP rank (desc)

qcHasParam.name: c:has
qcHasParam.description: Filters results by entries with non-NULL values in the given fields. Multiple fields can be comma-separated.

qcResolveParam.name: c:resolve
qcResolveParam.description: Include additional fields in the response. See the `resolve_list` field of the collection list for permissible values for a given collection.

qcCaseParam.name: c:case
qcCaseParam.description: Whether case sensitivity is enabled for string comparisongs. Defaults to true. Note that this impacts query performance, `ps2/character.name`, `ps2/outfit.name`, `ps2/outfit.alias` all provide lowercase variants for improved performance.

qcLimitParam.name: c:limit
qcLimitParam.description: Return up to N results from the collection. Defaults to 1.

qcLimitPerDbParam.name: c:limitPerDB
qcLimitPerDbParam.description: The `ps2/character` collection is distributed across 20 distinct databases. The per-DB limit may be more predictable in some use-cases. If set, `c:limit` will be ignored. For collections other than `ps2/character`, this parameter falls behaves exactly like `c:limit`.

qcStartParam.name: c:start
qcStartParam.description: Skips the first N results from the result list. Together with `c:limit`, can be used for pagination. Note that sorting may be required to get consistent orderings. Due to the multiple databases used, this behaves unusually for the `ps2/character` collection.

qcIncludeNullParam.name: c:includeNull
qcIncludeNullParam.description: Whether to include response keys for NULL values, rather than omitting them. Note that this does not return the canonical `null`, but the string `"NULL"`.

qcLangParam.name: c:lang
qcLangParam.description: By default, localized fields such as `ps2/item.name` will return results for all supported locales. This field allows specifying a single locale to return, greatly reducing response payload size.

qcJoinParam.name: c:join
qcJoinParam.description: Similar to `c:resolve`, but allows specifying arbitrary subqueries to add to the response. For details, see the [Census API documentation](https://census.daybreakgames.com/#collection-joining) or the community [Census API Primer](https://github.com/leonhard-s/auraxium/wiki/Census-API-Primer#joined-queries).

qcTreeParam.name: c:tree
qcTreeParam.description: Allows rearranging lists of result into a tree. See the [Census API documentation](https://census.daybreakgames.com/#tree-reformatting) for deatils.

qcTimingParam.name: c:timing
qcTimingParam.description: Adds the top-level field `timing` containing timing information to the result object. For queries using `c:resolve` or `c:join`, this also contains information about the subqueries.

qcExactMatchFirstParam.name: c:exactMatchFirst
qcExactMatchFirstParam.description: When performing fuzzy string queries, such as `^` (startswith) or `*` (contains), promote any match exactly matching the full input string to the top of the search list. Useful for user-facing name lookups.

qcDistinctParam.name: c:distinct
qcDistinctParam.description: Instead of fetching results, list all distinct values for a given field. Note that this may include duplicate entries for `ps2/character` due to the multiple databases. Results are truncated to 20'000 values.

qcRetryParam.name: c:retry
qcRetryParam.description: By default, the API will retry any queries once before failing. By setting this value to `false`, you can fail earlier, which can be useful if you have your own retry mechanisms or logging configuration.

characterIdParam.name: character_id
characterIdParam.description:
Unique identifier of a charcter. Note that character IDs are not guaranteed to be unique across games; the same ID may be assigned to different characters for `ps2` than for `ps2ps4us`.

When converting this value to native representations, note that a 64 bit integer type is required to avoid truncation.

characterNameFirstParam.name: name.first
characterNameFirstParam.description: Name of the character. Note that when looking up characters, it is preferable to query `name.first_lower` with a lowercase version of the search string.

characterNameFirstLowerParam.name: name.first_lower
characterNameFirstLowerParam.description: Lowercase version of `name.first`. When performing case-insensitive lookups, using this field is more performant than setting `c:case=false`.

count.description: The number of entries in this colleciton. The values `?` and `dynamic` both signify an uncountable collection. Note that even though no count is displayed here, it may still be accessible via the `count/{game}/{collection}` endpoint.

hidden.description: Whether this table is hidden from the API. Always false-y. Note that this may either be an actual `false` value, or the string `"false"`.

resolve_list.description: A list of resolvable names for the collection. These can be passed to the `c:resolve` query parameter to insert additional fields into the returned payload.

name.description: Name of the character. Use the `first_lower` field for faster case-insensitive searches without needing to set `c:case=false`.

faction_id.description: Faction of the character. For NSOs, this equals the value of NSOs. An NSOs currently or home faction is not exposed on the REST API, but can be determined via the `team_id` of some WebSocket payloads.

head_id.description: Identifier for the character's in-game model. Note that with gender change tokens, this is no longer guaranteed to be immutable across a character's career.

title_id.description: Currently selected title of the character. Useful for playing long names of players, e.g. "Snowblower Higby". A title ID of `0` corresponds to a player having selected "No Title" in-game.

times.description: Sub-object providing login time and playtime information.

last_save.description: Last time the character info was updated. This generally corresponds to the last time the character logged off. For this reason, characters are generally not available on the API during their first play session.

last_login.description: Last time the character logged in. Together with `last_save`, this can be used to construct the duration of the last play session of the character.

login_count.description: Number of individual logins by the character.

gifted_points.description: Certifications gifted through in-game events or refunds.

spent_points.description: Certifications points spent on skills and implant bundles.

percent_to_next.description: Progress to earning the next certification point (every 250 exp).

value.description: Current battle rank. Note that due to the A.S.P. prestige system, this is no longer sufficient to express player level. Always check `prestige_level` as well.

profile_id.description: Class of the character when the last logged off. This value can generally only be one of the 24 infantry classes available in the legacy `ps2/profile` collection, though other values are possible due to bad data or deleted characters.

daily_ribbon.description: Sub-object for daily ribbon bonuses. Note that ribbon bonuses have been disabled, rendering this object useless. It is recommended to treat is as optional in client code in case it ever gets removed from the response object.

count.description: Number of daily ribbon bonuses available for collection.

time.description: Next time a daily ribbon bonus will be granted.

prestige_level.description: The A.S.P. rank of the character.

name.description: Name of the character. Use the `first_lower` field for faster case-insensitive searches without needing to set `c:case=false`.

image_path.description: Relative path to the default image of the faction.

code_tag.description: The unique tag of the faction, or `None` for common-pool nanite systems.

user_selectable.description: Whether this faction is playable or reserved for NPCs.

profile_type_id.description: The type of the profile. There is no public `profile_type` collection, this is an internal ID.

image_path.description: Relative path to the default image of the profile.

movement_speed.description: The base movement speed of the profile.

backpedal_speed_modifier.description: The modifier applied to the movement speed when walking backwards.

sprint_speed_modifier.description: The modifier applied to the movement speed when sprinting.

crouch_speed_modifier.description: The modifier applied to the movement speed when crouching.

profile_id.description: Unique ID of the collection. Note that this is one of the few collections where the ID field is not `<collection>_id`.

description.description: Internal description of this profile. Not localized or user-facing.

tr.description: Turkish locale, unfinished and not available for most fields

collection_characterInfo.description:
Shows basic character information while hiding unwanted fields.
https://census.daybreakgames.com/get/ps2/character?c:show=name.first,faction_id,battle_rank.value,prestige_level

collection_factionTags.description:
Uses `c:distinct` to get all faction tags.
https://census.daybreakgames.com/get/ps2/faction?c:distinct=code_tag

collection_mapFacilities.description:
Example using nested key access to insert data into the middle of a payload. Note that only one record is shown for brevity, the provided link returns the entire zone's region list.
https://census.daybreakgames.com/get/ps2/map?world_id=1&zone_ids=2&c:join=map_region%5Einject_at:map_region%5Eon:Regions.Row.RowData.RegionId%5Eto:map_region_id
